summary:
Tony: why do people want quiet funerals? 
Tony: When I die I want my ashes mixed with glitter and packed tightly into my coffin...
body:
Tony: why do people want quiet funerals?

Tony: When I die I want my ashes mixed with glitter and packed tightly into my coffin along with explosives

Rhodey: Tony you cant do tha-

Tony: so when it blows up, glitter rains down on everyone while “thanks for the memories” by Fall Out Boy plays

Peter: big mood Mr. Stark, big mood

Tony: see?! He gets it

Rhodey: *on the verge of a mental breakdown*

@theincorrectavengers

body:
In Your Dying Moments || Peter Parker

Pairing: Peter Parker x Reader

Word count: 1,260

Summary: Soulmate AU where on everybody’s 18th birthday, they wake up with a tattoo of what their soulmate will first say to them. But in the time of dying, the invisible clock will show a zero when two people gaze at each other’s eyes as one finally takes their last breath.

{A/N: English isn’t my native language, I’m so sorry for the mistakes.

She waited for that moment her entire life. She had counted the time when that moment will happen, she had counted the years, months, weeks and even seconds. She had counted it all because she’s been waiting for so long. But the time was always passing too slowly. She dreamed about it every night, writing a different story in her little mind just before she fell asleep. She daydreamed about meeting him or her every free time she got, dreaming about what those special first words might be. People laughed at her naivety and childish thoughts, but she had never given in, Y/N had never stopped believing. Even when that time had come, and the moment was almost over.

That day, that one specific morning, Y/N remembered giving her mother a kiss, pressing it gently on her freckled cheek, inhaling the sweet strawberries scent shampoo her mother had used the night before. She remembered pulling away, whispering a soft ‘I love you’ and giving her the tenderest smile for one more time.

She felt it.

That day, Y/N remembered tightly hugging her dad and sincerely laughing with him at the silly anecdote which was written in the newspaper that he was holding in his hands in that specific morning. She remembered exchanging those silent ‘I love you’s’ and that lonely silver droplet rolling down her puffy red cheek as she finally turned away.

She knew it.

That day, Y/N remembered ruffling her little brother’s hair and that playful glare he gave her afterward. She remembered letting out a soft gasp and a muffled giggle as he gently poked her belly in return, and that puzzled look on his face when he caught a short glimpse of her glassy eyes as she eventually made her way out of the house.

It broke her.

That day, Y/N remembered the silent sobs escaping her pink lips as she gently shut the door behind her, knowing she would never open it ever again. And oh, oh how much on that specific day she remembered hiding that broken heart as she silently said goodbye.

For her clock was already ticking.

They say in your time of dying you see your whole life flashing before your eyes. It wasn’t very true to Y/N, but she did see something. The moments were blurry and it flashed as fast as lighting, giving just a split second to observe. But it was enough; it was enough for her to hold on just for one more minute.

That specific day, she remembered falling as the sharp pain pierced her skin. That day was the day she fell, but she fell with her head held high because she knew he was there to catch her. She remembered that unbearable pain shooting through her veins but having the strength to smile as she heard those special words that were only meant for her, the words that she so much dreamed of. She recollected feeling full.

“Miss! Miss, you have to hold on! The help is on its way.” The voice was soothing, even when it was filled with panic and worry. Y/N found it calming, just like her mother’s voice which always managed to calm her down with a quieting lullaby when she couldn’t sleep or the monsters from her nightmares were still haunting her. She felt safe as his tender arms gently cradling her head in his lap. “Miss, please, open your eyes.”

She did as she was told, her eyes fluttering open. For the first time in her life, her eyes finally were locked with her soulmate’s big but narrowed white ones? She frowned slightly, her mouth shaping into a small ‘o’ form as she realized he was just wearing a mask, yet Y/N’s eyes crinkled a little at the corners. She still thought he was beautiful, even when he was hiding his face.

“You’re… y-you’re him.” Her voice came out faint and hoarse, but it wasn’t it that made his heart beat faster, it wasn’t it that made his blood run cold. No, it was her very first words said to him and those small black letters on her skin as she weakly showed him her wrist. It was that small round clock showing numbers that were darting so fast before his eyes.

He knew what it meant; they both it. And as much as he didn’t want to believe it he knew there was nothing much left because the clock has never been broken and when that time comes, when the time runs out – it always stops at zero; No matter what.

“Can I…” Y/N grimaced in pain, her bottom lip trembling as she tried to reach his face with her fingers. “May I…” But she couldn’t finish her sentence; she didn’t need to, because he understood her, he understood what she wanted.

“Yes, yes. Of course,” He rapidly nodded his head and pulled off his mask, carelessly throwing it onto the ground.

The male underneath the mask was handsome. He had short brown hair which now was a little bit messy from the blowing wind. Yet it looked so soft that the lying girl just wanted to run her fingers through it. His eyes were a chocolate brown colour, holding so many emotions behind it. And his lips, oh his lips… it was thin and pink, looking so kissable. His skin was smooth as she gently ran her long fingers across his skin, her nails softly and shyly just for a moment grazing his lips.  

“Your… your eyes are s-shinning.” Y/N choked on her own blood as more tears threatened to stream down her cheeks.

“God,” he sniffed, trying to blink away his tears. “This… this w-was not suppose to-to happen-“ his chocolate brown eyes darted from her eyes to the wound on her abdomen, where his palm was pressed, trying to lessen the bleeding. “I–I’m so s-sorry. God this is all my f-fault…” He sobbed, hugging her more tightly as he continued to apologize.

“Hey, h-hey,” Y/N tried to get his attention and when she finally did, the dying girl smiled. “It’s okay. It’s okay. It’s perfect.” She whimpered as tears rolled down her cheeks. “T-there was nothing you could do…” Her voice was barely above a whisper. “There is no escape from fate.”

Soft cries could be heard as she tried so hard to breathe in, to hold on just for a few more seconds. “I don’t even know your name.”  

“Y/N,” She smiled through her tears and weakly placed her hand on his, her thumb gently caressing his skin.

“It’s not fair…”

“It’s perfect.” He clenched his jaw as her voice cracked. “I’m in the arms of my one and only; that’s all that matters. I’ve found what I’ve been searching for all my life. I found you.”    

That day, in that specific moment, she remembered dying in her soulmate’s arms as they both gazed at each other, as the clock stopped at zero, as she took her last breath, that single tear was rolling down her cheek because it was okay. It was perfect. It was enough.

summary: Peter: The main thing that I've from high school English is that, after you reach a certain age, the curriculum decides that...
body:
Peter: The main thing that I've from high school English is that, after you reach a certain age, the curriculum decides that books with happy endings and likable characters are stupid and babyish and that you’re only allowed dysfunction, oppression, and misery in your literature from now on.
Stephen: If you somehow avoided depression so far, the school will provide you with some.
Tony: If you do not have a depression, one will be allocated to you.

body:
Spiderverse theory/headcannon

RIPeter absolutely knew he was going to die.

Not at first. Not when meeting Miles, but, he knew when he was lying in that rubble that he was going to die. But the reason he promised Miles he’d come find him wasn’t for false reassurance. He knew the other spiders would show up.

After all, if he was able to tell king pin that what he was planning wasn’t going to work after looking into the gizmo, it stands to reason he saw the other spider-people there too.

He didn’t tell miles “I’ll come find you, it’ll be okay” as a way to reassure him that he’d survive. He said it because he knew that Peter B Parker would show up.

He made a promise and he kept it.

In fact, considering that Gwen, Ham, Noir, and Peni showed up along with 🅱️eter, he kept his promise five times over.

summary: Sticks and Stones May Break My Bones, But Words Will Hurt My Soul
title: Sticks and Stones May Break My Bones, But Words Will Hurt My Soul
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Hex8RR

by baloobird

“Uh-uh, no way, it’s just words, dude. They haven’t actually hurt me. Mr. Stark has enough on his plate to be bothered by pointless teen drama.”

Ned points at the phone again, “This isn’t ‘pointless teen drama’! This is bullying, actual bullying. All of those cheesy anti-bullying commercials are based on shit like this.”

Peter is being cyberbullied. He didn’t think it was anything to worry about, but he quickly learns that words can hurt too.

title: Get Out
body:
(Y/N) was on her way home from helping her mother-in-law out at this gathering she was hosting a gold club for the Hollands Trust charity. It was a casual event for woman which (Y/N) was excited to attend, but was also speaking at. Tom caught a glimpse of her beautiful blue dress this morning, which reached down just below her knees. He couldn’t stop thinking about how great his wife looked all day

7: 00 PM

When she entered the flat things were too quiet.

“Honey, I’m home!” She called out, but there was no answer. (Y/N) placed her coat on the rack and then took of her shoes. The woman walked straight to the bedroom where she heard muffled talking.

When she opened the door, her mouth dropped and she couldn’t believe her eyes.

15 Minutes Earlier

Toms POV

Tom was cooking dinner for (Y/N) since she knew his wife was spending time with his mother which made him happy.

He was making lasagna with some garlic bread along with some red wine for the both of them. Tom knew she was going to be home in a bit so he was in the finishing stages of the dinner when all of a sudden, the doorbell rang.

He wiped his hands on a cloth before setting everything down. The man ran over to the door and once he opened it, his eyes went wide.

“Hello Tom.” It was none other than Pamela.

Pam, the woman staying over at their flat because she was a close friend of (Y/N)’s mother and growing up she would always be around. She was super sweet and loved (Y/N) as her own daughter, but Pam was also very attractive. Blonde hair and a slim body which could pull off practically any look. She was also smart and funny. Pam basically had it all, but always dressed to impress.

(Y/N) knew that all the boys had a crush on Pam, even Dom. But thought that she would never do anything to jeopardize any relationship.

“Um, hi Pam. (Y/N) should be home any minute so come in and have a seat.” Tom invited the woman who was half his age inside.

“Thank you.” Pam said as she entered the flat. Tom shut the door behind her leaving it unlocked for his wife.

“Are you making something? It smells delicious.” Pamela said as she took off her coat.

“Oh yeah, I am going to surprise (Y/N) with a special dinner I made for the two of us. By the way, can you watch the stove? I’m just going to go get something from the bedroom.” Tom asked and Pam nodded with a smile.

Tom smiled in return and then ran to the bedroom to get changed for (Y/N). He wanted to look good and make it romantic for his wife. The guy couldn’t be more excited to see her reaction.

He took off his shirt and laid out a white dress shirt across the bed and smiled as he imagined how his wife would react.

All of a sudden, the door opened and Pam walked in. Tom got very startled and freaked out grabbing a towel and wrapping it around himself.

“Oh, Tom, sorry. I was just coming into say that the lasagna was ready and hot.” She said and Tom stood there nervously.

“Okay, thanks. Um, I’ll be out in a few seconds.” He said slightly embarrassed. 

Pam bit her lip and stepped into the room shutting the door behind her with her foot. She slowly walked towards Tom seductively. The guy didn’t know what to do, he was panicking inside. She was a few feet apart from him and then ran her finger down his bicep which was covered by the towel.

“Take it off.” She whispered in his ear.

“WHAT THE FUCK?” (Y/N) yelled and they both shot their head to the door. Tom saw the look on his wife’s face and he was heartbroken at the sight.

She stormed back towards the door of the flat and Tom quickly threw on a t-shirt and sprinted after her.

“(Y/N) please wait!” He took a hold of her arm, but she immediately pulled it back with force and whipped her head around. Her body turned to face him with her eyes being filled with tears,

“It’s not what it looks like.” Tom said and she was so tempted to just slap him right in this moment.

“He’s right, it was me who was coming onto him. Tom is innocent and I admit that. I am so sorry, (Y/N). I don’t know what came over me.” Pam said as she approached them.

Tom was relieved, but also heartbroken at the sight of his wife.

“I promise, that’s all true.” Tom said and (Y/N) shook her head.

“If I wasn’t here, what would’ve happened?” She asked clenching her teeth together as a few tears ran down her face.

“What?” Pam asked taking a few steps towards them.

(Y/N) looked at her with the angriest expression like she was about to attack and then she looked back at Tom and the expression wiped off her face into sadness.

“What would’ve happened if I wasn’t here, Tom?” She asked and wasn’t playing any games.

“Nothing, love. I would never ever cheat on you.” Tom said and (Y/N) wasn’t having it.

“Really?” (Y/N)’s tears had stopped at this point and she just looked frustrated and angry.

“Tom is a good guy (Y/N), he really loves you and would never do anything to hurt you. That I know for a fact. You can hate me all you want, I understand that. But Tom, he’d never hurt you.” Pamela said and then tears started to form in Tom’s eyes.

“(Y/N) you are my everything, I would never ever hurt you by cheating. I will never be that type of guy because I love and respect you, so much. Please, you have to believe me.” He took his hand in hers and it was like he was begging for his life. Tom couldn’t stand the idea of him ever loosing (Y/N).

She was his entire world, the person who kept him grounded and inspired him to never give up on the important things in life. The individual who was his other half, his equal. He couldn’t stand the thought of letting go of her.

“I love you Mrs. Holland, forever.” Tom said and kissed the tip of her hand where her wedding ring is located.

“I love you too, Mr. Holland.” She said and wrapped her arms around his neck.

“I promise I would never cheat, nothing happened here tonight and nothing was going to happen.” Tom whispered in her ear and then kissed her cheek. She cried into his shoulder and looked up at Pam standing behind him.

“Get out!” (Y/N) said and then Pam ran for the door and (Y/N) followed behind her.

“If you ever make a move on my husband or any other guy I know who’s in a relationship, you’ll be dealing with me and trust me, you don’t want that!” (Y/N) said and then slammed the door on her face locking it afterwards.

“That was so hot,” Tom said and then she smiled and kissed him.

“Now, I have a surprise for you my love.” He said and walked her over to the table where he seated her.

“You’re in for a romantic evening, Mrs. Holland.” He said and then his wife smiled.

summary: Imagine: Being Peter's Older Sister, and Having Some Seriously Charming Abilities That The Team Finds Useful When the team found...
body:
Imagine: Being Peter’s Older Sister, and Having Some Seriously Charming Abilities That The Team Finds Useful

When the team found that this mission was going to be much more difficult than they’d hoped, Peter had come to the conclusion that you, (Y/N) Parker, may be exactly what they needed to succeed.

You were only twenty-one, but your little brother had seen you charm your way out of trouble and charm your way into getting what you wanted. Even Aunt May had to admit that you had a mesmerizing gift, and honestly, your aunt was quite proud of it—often saying you got it from your father. She was especially proud because you never used your so-called gift to do any harm, it was purely for keeping you and Peter out of trouble. He was Spider-Man, after all, and he often turned to you to back him up.

Which lead to this exact moment—where the team was ready to barge in to the unsespecting building and risk their lives for something, where you would simply be able to strut on in, shine your pretty little smile, then walk on out with exactly what they needed.

“Who is that?” Tony practically gawked, his widened eyes were hidden behind his mask. The rest of the team turned to look at where he was, only to let themselves follow Tony’s lead in gawking.

“Oh, that’s my older sister, (Y/N),” Peter nodded casually, crossing his arms over his chest as confidence spurred through him—with you here to enhance the target with your charm, there was no way they could lose. “She’s always been really good at, like, charming people and stuff. So I asked her to meet us here all dolled up to do just that.”

And you were really gonna do just that; you were wearing a basic little black dress, hair pulled up into an elegant bun and your beautifully toned legs confidentally pulled you towards the team—where even Natasha was mind-boggled by your appearance.

You stopped next to Bucky, who swallowed as he looked you over, who would’ve thought that Peter had a hot older sister?

“Know how to fight?” Steve asked, coming up with absolutely any reason to talk to you, and Clint glared at him for stealing the opportunity.

“Not exactly,” you responded, your voice coming out silky smooth and gentle. You were gorgeous, but generously innocent, and that added so much more to your charm. You smiled sheepishly, “Never thought I’d be getting myself into something like this.”

“Well, should we get out of this situstion of ours alive, my lady, then I am free to teach you everything I know.” Thor grinned, confidently.

Peter suddenly caught onto why all his male teammates were all sharing the same look as they looked you over.

“Guys, chill, this is NOT why I asked my sister to meet us here!”

“Not exactly,” you responded, your voice coming out silky smooth and gentle. You were gorgeous, but generously innocent, and that added so much more to your charm. You smiled sheepishly, “Never thought I’d be getting myself into something like this.”

“Well, should we get out of this situstion of ours alive, my lady, then I am free to teach you everything I know.” Thor grinned, confidently.

Peter suddenly caught onto why all his male teammates were all sharing the same look as they looked you over.

“Guys, chill, this is NOT why I asked my sister to meet us here!”

You were only twenty-one, but your little brother had seen you charm your way out of trouble and charm your way into getting what you wanted. Even Aunt May had to admit that you had a mesmerizing gift, and honestly, your aunt was quite proud of it—often saying you got it from your father. She was especially proud because you never used your so-called gift to do any harm, it was purely for keeping you and Peter out of trouble. He was Spider-Man, after all, and he often turned to you to back him up.

Which lead to this exact moment—where the team was ready to barge in to the unsespecting building and risk their lives for something, where you would simply be able to strut on in, shine your pretty little smile, then walk on out with exactly what they needed.

“Who is that?” Tony practically gawked, his widened eyes were hidden behind his mask. The rest of the team turned to look at where he was, only to let themselves follow Tony’s lead in gawking.

“Oh, that’s my older sister, (Y/N),” Peter nodded casually, crossing his arms over his chest as confidence spurred through him—with you here to enhance the target with your charm, there was no way they could lose. “She’s always been really good at, like, charming people and stuff. So I asked her to meet us here all dolled up to do just that.”
